title: Some shift left operations of signed integers panic in debug
body:
Hi, some shift-left operations on signed integers do panic with 'attempt to negate with overflow' when built as debug binaries. I tried this code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=a06e4fc5e6e3835be1108e6a1bb665aa ```rust trait Test { fn shl2(self, rhs: Self) -> Self; } impl Test for i8 { fn shl2(self, rhs: Self) -> Self { self << rhs } } fn main() { println!("{}", -28_i8 << 5); println!("{}", -28_i8.shl2(5)); println!("{}", -28_i8.wrapping_shl(5)); } ``` For reproducing the error, this is enough: ```rust fn main() { println!("{}", -28_i8.wrapping_shl(5)); } ``` It seems to affect all kinds of wrapping the left shift into a function. But not all combinations of operands are affected, for example `-28_i8.wrapping_shl(6)` and `-28_i8.wrapping_shl(4)` work as intended. I expected to see this happen: ``` -128 -128 -128 ``` as it does in mode=release. Instead, this happened: ``` thread 'main' panicked at 'attempt to negate with overflow', src/main.rs:13:20 ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0 (84c898d65 2023-04-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 84c898d65adf2f39a5a98507f1fe0ce10a2b8dbc commit-date: 2023-04-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0 LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` but it happens in the beta and nightly channels on the Rust Playground as of this date as well.
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/84c898d65adf2f39a5a98507f1fe0ce10a2b8dbc/library/std/src/panicking.rs:579:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/84c898d65adf2f39a5a98507f1fe0ce10a2b8dbc/library/core/src/panicking.rs:64:14 2: core::panicking::panic at /rustc/84c898d65adf2f39a5a98507f1fe0ce10a2b8dbc/library/core/src/panicking.rs:114:5 3: playground::main at ./[src/main.rs:13](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=a06e4fc5e6e3835be1108e6a1bb665aa#):20 4: core::ops::function::FnOnce::call_once at /rustc/84c898d65adf2f39a5a98507f1fe0ce10a2b8dbc/library/core/src/ops/function.rs:250:5 ```
